description: Since the 19th century, immigrants from Asia and the Pacific Islands have formed
communities whose writing has expressed their shifting role as Asian Americans in the
culture and economy of the United States. This course provides a multi-genre overview of
Asian-American literary traditions in socio-historical context and pays attention to
current concerns such as diasporic displacement, gender, intergenerational conflicts,
sexuality, transnationalism, and U.S. militarism. Offered periodically. Counts toward race and
ethnic studies major and concentration. Prerequisite: FYW.
